intro: Adenandra dahlgrenii, commonly known as the mountain adenandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Adenandra dahlgrenii is adapted to dry conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
